embeds.title: Liquidate

Rare Skill / The Slime Boss

**Unplayable** if you have negative **Strength:p_strength:**.

messages.content: Because it just turns shapers blessing into 2 cost gain 2 potency
I don't think those numbers add up the way you think they do
or you could instead take 2 split cards, which absorb twice to gain 2 strength and also do stuff
Isn't that still 2 energy though?
for buffing 1 point str
and maybe nerf 1 plated armor for + as tradeoff

We discussed this not too long ago in strategy and deckbuilding, the general consensus was that the plated armor is a reasonable deal, but that the strength is too low. However, In my opinion, the power of this card is in it's flexibility. Very few cards in StS let you make modal decisions like that, and it's really nice to have access to either extra offense or defense depending on what the current fight is asking for. It being available to every class is also another significant factor, on some classes, strength is more valuable/harder to find (guardian, automaton, gremlins all really like strength). I think it's pretty well balanced at 2 cost right now. Wish from watcher also only gives 3(4) strength, or 6(8) plated armor for 3 cost, and has the additional option of 25(30) gold. Granted, strength is extra valuable on watcher due to the interaction with wrath/divinity, but in both cases, they are less efficient than inflame because they have more flexibility than it. It also becomes a much better card with relics like mummified hand and bird faced urn, or in decks that already have access to recurring armor through thread and needle, brass tacks, or orichalcum. I'm not buying this from shops aggressively, but there are plenty of situations where I can offset the cost, and the flexibility between modes is helpful in giving a deck multiple ways to play different fights

I agree that the strength portion of this card is useful. Although you take plated armor most of the time having the option to choose strength makes this card decently versatile and thus gives more value on average then most other boss cards do when you get one from a random effect (the most common way to see boss cards!).
two cost doesnt mean a whole lot when your getting this card for free most of the time. If you are given the choice to add it to your deck, two cost is a good deal for 8 plated armor anyways.

Guardian already has plenty of strength gain through debuff removal strats, and charge up, and probably something else I forgot. idk too much about auto but I know <philosophize> and I think <boost> are strength gain

But well just gonna go back to shaper's blessing because this conversation has been derailed very far (a lot of it is my fault).

Overall general consensus seems that the strength option is pretty weak, but 8 played armor for 2 cost is pretty good. I don't think it really needs changes, but if I had to elect something I'd say bring up the strength by 1. Most downfall characters don't struggle with scaling too much, and I feel like the only class where I really would take the strength would be gremlins.
Although I think keeping it the way it is would be a better option.
doesnt every single downfall character have consistent strengh scaling?
